text: who love this record anything baby hi
everyone Anthony Fantana here
Internet's busiest music nerd back again
with an album review twin shadow confess
this is the solo project of frontman and
singer-songwriter George Lewis junior
multi-instrumentalist to his debut LP
forget I reviewed the year came out
pretty positively an album that on first
listen really underwhelmed me a bit but
then I gave it a second chance once I
realized that that Chris Taylor of
grizzly-bear had produced it and
released it on his own label because the
selfie is kind of understated a very
understated approach to new wave pop but
there are all these really subtle
elements to it that I think are really
nice Chris Taylor brings some very great
color very subtle colors to a lot of
these tracks a lot of the bass lines are
great very danceable the drums are
really grooving
but in my original review I acknowledged
how quiet this record felt the
production style that I liked was kind
of holding this project back from bigger
things and I said that if George ever
put out a record with higher quality
production and and stuck roughly to his
same style he would be a pretty big
threat in indie music the better
production I wanted is here Plus this LP
right out of the gate is getting a
release on 4ad records on paper some
great things are occurring but in fact I
wanted from this album is not here at
least on a personal level anyway I'm
really not digging confess I'm gonna be
blunt it's gonna be straight with it the
NuWave influence that was on twin
shadows last LP it is here and it's
stronger than ever the songs and the
sounds on this thing referenced the path
but our unmistakeably knew which is a
bit more refreshing than reverb soaked
and tuneless nostalgia but by kind of
coming through with a clearer sound this
time around I feel like inadvertently
George has exposed a few weak links in
twin shadows chain for one the vocals on
this new record I feel like now that I'm
really kind of hearing George
front-and-center
he doesn't feel like a very captivating
frontman their tracks on here where he
belts and and hit some of those highs
really well comes off pretty emotive the
song 5 seconds is an example but other
tracks on here he just feels like he's
weaving in an app tune he's kind of
whimpering and really awkward very
awkward for for me the listener to kind
of sit through it you can call me on as
an example and and the intro to the the
track when the movie is over
I was really sitting there thinking is
he trying to sing is this singing he's
singing here the vocals on this thing
can really be a hit or a huge huge miss
which is kind of sad because I've seen
twin shadow live at least twice and I
don't really recall them being that huge
of an issue now the lyrics on this thing
too are another issue for me they're
nowhere near as abstract as they were on
forget and because of that there's just
less mysticism what I'm talking about
our lyrics that are really vague
melodramatic and shallow references to
love and hearts that couldn't really be
anything but but just insincere cliche
stuff that sounds like it's been copied
and pasted really transplanted into
these songs to kind of give them a a
semblance of emotion actually being
there but none of it is really tangible
let me tell you the heart better be your
favorite organ in the human body because
you're gonna hear about it a lot it's
just the kind of stuff that's very
palatable and fun and perfect when
you're listening to a very popular
single from the era of music that this
sound actually comes from in that case
you're kind of hearing the cream of the
crop you're only getting a small dose
and I really have no reason to believe
that this album does what the 80s did
any better than how the 80s did it plus
the cleaner production this time around
has made some of the songs on here feel
a little sanitized which does not spell
out good results when it comes to some
of the dancer tracks on here because
they really don't have that
momentum all the songs on here are since
soaked there's a mixture of real drums
and drum machines very rigid bass lines
and some of the courses on here do
explode beautifully I'll say but for the
most part I feel like the songwriting
the production the instrumentation it's
just kind of man it just gets the job
done it's sweet while it's on but
there's no real memorable impact that
goes on with this LP now I do see the
appeal behind this album if you are into
it not saying you shouldn't be but me
personally just not really getting much
out of this thing I'm kind of feeling a
strong forward to a like five on this LP
what did you guys think of it did you
love it
did you hate it why and what should I
review next did you have high hopes for
this thing after enjoying twin shadows
debut LP let me know Anthony Fantana
twin shadow forever
